page.title: 10A Sheep Farm In Dymchurch
page.content: Mr Bert Uden owns High Knock Farm in St Mary's Road.It is 120 acres.1 acre of farm land costs about Â£2000.Mr Uden spends about Â£3000 on sheep & lambs a year.His flock is made up of about 500 ewes & 400 lambs of the Romney Marsh breed.A ewe at Ashford Market can fetch Â£65 & a ram Â£300,if it is a good one.A sheep dog called Canary Dog works the flock.Mr Uden's sheep are marked with his sign - HU - Herbert Uden.The sheep are sheared every year, when each animal gives about 7 pounds of wool.Sheep are in danger from such diseases as footrot,scab,tetanus and pulpa kidney.They are regularly dipped in disinfectant as a precaution.Foxes sometimes steal the lambs.People walking through the farm must remember to keep their dogs on leads and to shut the gates.2 workers help Mr Uden with the farming.
